page.title: 03HOUSING / BUILDINGS CRANAGE
page.content: Most of the housing is in the east of the area on the edge of the village of Holmes Chapel. Here the houses have been built over the last twenty years. They range from detached and semi-datached houses and bungalows to a mews of private flats. The rest of the housing is much older than the estates and is scattered over the area. There is a mixture of farm houses and buildings, the one opposite our school is over 350 years old, cottages and terraced houses. Most of these have been built during the last 100 years. As well as the houses there is also Cranage Hall Hospital, which has homes in its grounds for the hospital workers. The oldest building in the grounds is the Hall itself which is around 200 years old. cont'd on p.4.
